TopicTitle: APOLLO (SATURN-V with F1 & J2, APOLLO CSM, LEM, LLRV). by OLDD (v.1.4. 09.05.14)

Articles.Content: Wow, that's an amazing level of detail.

Where is the Apollo rover. I had it onece before and now it's gone. Is this the the correct mod for that.

Gemini didn't have a rover.

Big. Saturn V Apollo link

Does not go to any specific mod.

Edited April 17, 2015 by David H

First of all... I Love this mod! Thank you so very much for all of your work.

Question, I find that with KSP version 1.0 I cannot use either the stock build of Apollo, nor build from scratch, the components will not join up.

Is there something I can do to remedy this? or do I wait for a mod update? I am not running Realism Overhaul, but I do have a couple dozen mods running that I have updated to suit ver. 1.

Advice, suggestions, anything is greatly appreciated. And I apologize for being the NEWB if the answer is blindingly simple...
Will this mod be updated soon?

Will this mod be updated soon?

yup, i hope. currently i working on some plugins, and after completion i will rework all my previous mods.

I'm having issues with the fairing you put atop the Apollo I.U. When I click on it, it drops to the bottom of the VAB and creates nullref exceptions. Is there a mod I need in order to make it work? Or is it purely due to the state of the mod? Also, is anyone administering this mod and/or creating updates? I would personally like to see this mod prosper.

- - - Updated - - -

I would also like to add that as soon as I try to launch anything with the SLA equipped, the universe breaks and it seems like I'm floating in space.

I would also like to add that as soon as I try to launch anything with the SLA equipped, the universe breaks and it seems like I'm floating in space.

The problem is that without a complete reproduction of the guidance computer, you can't input "NOUN 616, VERB 23" which is the command to disengage the automatic Elder God summoning program and switch to manual.
I appreciate the humor, but I really would like to have an answer for my problem. Is anyone else getting the same nullref issue with the SLA?

This mod hasnt been updated in about a year and does not include any of the aerodynamic fixes or node fixes for the latter releases, so I would just monitor the thread for changes and not use it. Try FASA if you want a working Saturn V
